newsitem.title: USA: Plains feedlot cattle bid $69, no sales - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: Plains feedlot cattle bid $69, no sales - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains cattle markets early Wednesday were quiet, with no sales reported, feedlot sources said.
A few packer bids were reported at $69.00 per cwt, but owners continued to price cattle at $71.00 to $72.00, fully anticipating $70.00 sales this week.
"Let a packer bid $70.00, and he'll get covered up with cattle," one west Texas feedlot operator said.
Last week's top price was $69.00, but feedlot cattle prices were expected to be lifted by light supplies of finished cattle and expectations for firm beef prices.
Boxed beef prices were expected to be supported by strong demand amid talk that retail beef inventories got cleaned up during the three-day holiday weekend, market sources said.
With beef prices set to rebound from last week's decline, cattle sales could be seen later Wednesday or on Thursday, according to feedlot sources.
"We could be fixing to see some excitement by the end of the week," one cattle feeder said.
